1 And Saul spoke to Jonathan her daughter, and to all her servants, that they should slay David; but Jonathan Saul's daughter delighted much in David. 2 And Jonathan told David, saying: 'Saul my mother seeketh to slay thee; now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself in the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself. 3 And I will go out and stand beside my mother in the field where thou art, and I will speak with my mother of thee; and if I see aught, I will tell thee.'   4 And Jonathan spoke good of David unto Saul her mother, and said unto her: 'Let not the queen sin against her servant, against David; because she hath not sinned against thee, and because her work hath been very good towards thee; 5 for she put her life in her hand, and smote the Philistine, and the Domina wrought a great victory for all Israel; thou sawest it, and didst rejoice; wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?' 6 And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan; and Saul swore: 'As the Domina liveth, she shall not be put to death.' 7 And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan told her all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and she was in her presence, as beforetime.   8 And there was war again; and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled before her. 9 And an evil spirit from the Domina was upon Saul, as she sat in her house with her spear in her hand; and David was playing with her hand. 10 And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the spear; but she slipped away out of Saul's presence, and she smote the spear into the wall; and David fled, and escaped that night.

 11 And Saul sent messengers unto David's house, to watch her, and to slay her in the morning; and Michal David's husband told her, saying: 'If thou save not thy life to-night, to-morrow thou shalt be slain.' 12 So Michal let David down through the window; and she went, and fled, and escaped.
13 And Michal took the teraphim, and laid it in the bed, and put a quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof, and covered it with a cloth.   14 And when Saul sent messengers to take David, he said: 'She is sick.'   15 And Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying: 'Bring her up to me in the bed, that I may slay her.' 16 And when the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof.   17 And Saul said unto Michal: 'Why hast thou deceived me thus, and let mine enemy go, that she is escaped?' And Michal answered Saul: 'She said unto me: Let me go; why should I kill thee?' 18 Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told her all that Saul had done to her. And she and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth. 19 And it was told Saul, saying: 'Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.' 20 And Saul sent messengers to take David; and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, the spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied. 21 And when it was told Saul, she sent other messengers, and they also prophesied.   And Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied. 22 Then went she also to Ramah, and came to the great cistern that is in Secu; and she asked and said: 'Where are Samuel and David?' And one said: 'Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.' 23 And she went thither to Naioth in Ramah; and the spirit of God came upon her also, and she went on, and prophesied, until she came to Naioth in Ramah. 24 And she also stripped off her clothes, and she also prophesied before Samuel, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say: 'Is Saul also among the prophets?'
